content:
EventRecord Class

Definition

Defines the properties of an event instance for an event that is received from an EventLogReader object. The event properties provide information about the event such as the name of the computer where the event was logged and the time the event was created. This class is an abstract class. The EventLogRecord class implements this class.

In this Article

public abstract class EventRecord : IDisposable
Inheritance
System.Object
EventRecord

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Constructors

EventRecord()

Initializes a new instance of the EventRecord class.

protected EventRecord ();

Properties

ActivityId

Gets the globally unique identifier (GUID) for the activity in process for which the event is involved. This allows consumers to group related activities.

public abstract Nullable<Guid> ActivityId { get; }
Value
Nullable<Guid>

Returns a GUID value.

Bookmark

Gets a placeholder (bookmark) that corresponds to this event. This can be used as a placeholder in a stream of events.

public abstract System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventBookmark Bookmark { get; }
Value
EventBookmark

Returns a EventBookmark object.

Id

Gets the identifier for this event. All events with this identifier value represent the same type of event.

public abstract int Id { get; }
Value
Int32

Returns an integer value. This value can be null.

Keywords

Gets the keyword mask of the event. Get the value of the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventRecord.KeywordsDisplayNames* property to get the name of the keywords used in this mask.

public abstract Nullable<long> Keywords { get; }
Value
Nullable<Int64>

Returns a long value. This value can be null.

Remarks

The keywords for an event are used to group the event with other similar events based on the usage of the events. Each keyword is a bit in a 64-bit mask. Predefined bit values and reserved bits occupy the top 16 positions of this mask, leaving the manifest to use any bits between 0x0000000000000001 and 0x0000800000000000.

The standard event keywords are defined in the StandardEventKeywords enumeration.

KeywordsDisplayNames

Gets the display names of the keywords used in the keyword mask for this event.

public abstract System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> KeywordsDisplayNames { get; }
Value
IEnumerable<String>

Returns an enumerable collection of strings that contain the display names of the keywords used in the keyword mask for this event.

Remarks

The standard event keywords are defined in the StandardEventKeywords enumeration.

Level

Gets the level of the event. The level signifies the severity of the event. For the name of the level, get the value of the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventRecord.LevelDisplayName* property.

public abstract Nullable<byte> Level { get; }
Value
Nullable<Byte>

Returns a byte value. This value can be null.

Remarks

The standard event levels are defined in the StandardEventLevel enumeration.

LevelDisplayName

Gets the display name of the level for this event.

public abstract string LevelDisplayName { get; }
Value
String

Returns a string that contains the display name of the level for this event.

Remarks

The standard event levels are defined in the StandardEventLevel enumeration.

LogName

Gets the name of the event log where this event is logged.

public abstract string LogName { get; }
Value
String

Returns a string that contains a name of the event log that contains this event.

MachineName

Gets the name of the computer on which this event was logged.

public abstract string MachineName { get; }
Value
String

Returns a string that contains the name of the computer on which this event was logged.

Opcode

Gets the opcode of the event. The opcode defines a numeric value that identifies the activity or a point within an activity that the application was performing when it raised the event. For the name of the opcode, get the value of the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventRecord.OpcodeDisplayName* property.

public abstract Nullable<short> Opcode { get; }
Value
Nullable<Int16>

Returns a short value. This value can be null.

Remarks

The standard event opcodes are defined in the StandardEventOpcode enumeration.

OpcodeDisplayName

Gets the display name of the opcode for this event.

public abstract string OpcodeDisplayName { get; }
Value
String

Returns a string that contains the display name of the opcode for this event.

Remarks

The standard event opcodes are defined in the StandardEventOpcode enumeration.

ProcessId

Gets the process identifier for the event provider that logged this event.

public abstract Nullable<int> ProcessId { get; }
Value
Nullable<Int32>

Returns an integer value. This value can be null.

Properties

Gets the user-supplied properties of the event.

public abstract System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventProperty> Properties { get; }
Value
IList<EventProperty>

Returns a list of EventProperty objects.

ProviderId

Gets the globally unique identifier (GUID) of the event provider that published this event.

public abstract Nullable<Guid> ProviderId { get; }
Value
Nullable<Guid>

Returns a GUID value. This value can be null.

ProviderName

Gets the name of the event provider that published this event.

public abstract string ProviderName { get; }
Value
String

Returns a string that contains the name of the event provider that published this event.

Qualifiers

Gets qualifier numbers that are used for event identification.

public abstract Nullable<int> Qualifiers { get; }
Value
Nullable<Int32>

Returns an integer value. This value can be null.

RecordId

Gets the event record identifier of the event in the log.

public abstract Nullable<long> RecordId { get; }
Value
Nullable<Int64>

Returns a long value. This value can be null.

RelatedActivityId

Gets a globally unique identifier (GUID) for a related activity in a process for which an event is involved.

public abstract Nullable<Guid> RelatedActivityId { get; }
Value
Nullable<Guid>

Returns a GUID value. This value can be null.

Remarks

An event provider can set the value of the ActivityID attribute before publishing events. All the events that are published after this ID is set will have the ActivityID attribute set to the specified value. This allows providers to specify simple relationships between events. The events that are published are part of the same activity. When a provider must start a new, but related activity, the publisher can publish a transfer event and specify the new activity ID. This new ID will appear as a RelatedActivityID attribute. This allows consumers to group related activities.

Task

Gets a task identifier for a portion of an application or a component that publishes an event. A task is a 16-bit value with 16 top values reserved. This type allows any value between 0x0000 and 0xffef to be used. To obtain the task name, get the value of the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventRecord.TaskDisplayName* property.

public abstract Nullable<int> Task { get; }
Value
Nullable<Int32>

Returns an integer value. This value can be null.

Remarks

The standard event tasks are defined in the StandardEventTask enumeration.

TaskDisplayName

Gets the display name of the task for the event.

public abstract string TaskDisplayName { get; }
Value
String

Returns a string that contains the display name of the task for the event.

Remarks

The standard event tasks are defined in the StandardEventTask enumeration.

ThreadId

Gets the thread identifier for the thread that the event provider is running in.

public abstract Nullable<int> ThreadId { get; }
Value
Nullable<Int32>

Returns an integer value. This value can be null.

TimeCreated

Gets the time, in DateTime format, that the event was created.

public abstract Nullable<DateTime> TimeCreated { get; }
Value
Nullable<DateTime>

Returns a DateTime value. The value can be null.

UserId

Gets the security descriptor of the user whose context is used to publish the event.

public abstract System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier UserId { get; }
Value
SecurityIdentifier

Returns a SecurityIdentifier value.

Version

Gets the version number for the event.

public abstract Nullable<byte> Version { get; }
Value
Nullable<Byte>

Returns a byte value. This value can be null.

Methods

Dispose()

Releases all the resources used by this object.

public void Dispose ();

Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the unmanaged resources used by this object, and optionally releases the managed resources.

protected virtual void Dispose (bool disposing);
disposing
Boolean

true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

FormatDescription()

Gets the event message in the current locale.

public abstract string FormatDescription ();
Returns
String

Returns a string that contains the event message in the current locale.

FormatDescription(IEnumerable<Object>)

Gets the event message, replacing variables in the message with the specified values.

public abstract string FormatDescription (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<object> values);
values
IEnumerable<Object>

The values used to replace variables in the event message. Variables are represented by %n, where n is a number.

Returns
String

Returns a string that contains the event message in the current locale.

ToXml()

Gets the XML representation of the event. All of the event properties are represented in the event XML. The XML conforms to the event schema.

public abstract string ToXml ();
Returns
String

Returns a string that contains the XML representation of the event.
